meanings.definition: A member or follower of any of the Western Christian churches that are separate from the Roman Catholic Church and follow the principles of the Reformation, including the Baptist, Presbyterian, and Lutheran churches.
meanings.sent1: The protestant attended the Baptist church every Sunday.
meanings.sent2: Many protestants celebrate Christmas in a similar way.
meanings.sent3: The protestant accidentally walked into the wrong church and was surprised.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her faith made her a true protestant in the eyes of her community.
meanings.sent5: The protestant's voice echoed through the church as she sang hymns.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to Protestants or Protestantism.
meanings.sent1: The protestant beliefs influenced her decision to join the Presbyterian church.
meanings.sent2: The family's protestant traditions were passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: His protestant sense of humor always lightened the mood at gatherings.
meanings.sent4: The protestant influence could be seen in the architecture of the new church building.
meanings.sent5: The protestant community came together to help those in need during the holiday season.
